text: Hong Ying exhibits incredible affinity with the Yin Wind of Magic. His "staff" manifests as a blade wreathed in ink jade flames, transforming to channel magic or strike down foes when needed.
Jade-Blooded Rune Magic is a unique development of the Qi wind by Jade-Blooded Taoists. It stores magic winds in talismans, providing a potent aid even when effects cannot be fully controlled.
Legend has it that "Shadow Gleam" is an illusion of the Moon Empress. The Onyx Crowmen can only commune with the Yin Wind and transform into the Yuanzhuo upon hearing its call.
The best way to counter spellcasters is to sever their connection to the Winds of Magic.
A raging jade lion harnesses the Winds of Magic, channeling their destructive charge into an unparalleled force.
A colossal bolt of lightning shoots from the engine, and the spear of the Skink God cleaves through enemy ranks, leaving ravines filled with shredded flesh.
Izzchi, the ancient god of cold-blooded beasts, commands the engine to unleash arcane powers and tame wild natures.
The Horned Rat manifests in one of its terrifying aspects: the Lords of Ruin, living catastrophes heralding destruction and desolation from the Chaos Wastes.
The Horned Rat manifests in one of its terrifying aspects: the Lords of Ruin, living catastrophes heralding destruction and desolation from the Chaos Wastes.
The Horned Rat manifests in one of its terrifying aspects: the Lords of Ruin, living catastrophes heralding destruction and desolation from the Chaos Wastes.
The Horned Rat manifests in one of its terrifying aspects: the Lords of Ruin, living catastrophes heralding destruction and desolation from the Chaos Wastes.
The Horned Rat manifests in one of its terrifying aspects: the Lords of Ruin, living catastrophes heralding destruction and desolation from the Chaos Wastes.
The Horned Rat manifests in one of its terrifying aspects: the Lords of Ruin, living catastrophes heralding destruction and desolation from the Chaos Wastes.
The Horned Rat manifests in one of its terrifying aspects: the Lords of Ruin, living catastrophes heralding destruction and desolation from the Chaos Wastes.
Raise a toast, fortify the hold, and drown in merry laughter!
You'll not pass, foul creature! By my beard, I swear it!
For the mountains and the ancestors' glory!
The forge blazes, the hammers ring, and masterworks are born!
The Rune of Thunder flashes brilliantly, summoning an overwhelming storm as if Grungni himself swung his anvil.
The cannons roar, the smoke clears, the mountains tremble in triumphant song!
Slay dragons, scour the wastes, and annihilate the Chaos hordes!
Ugh, whatever this concoction is, it seems to invigorate the Gnoblars who drink it, making them unnervingly energetic!
Hey boss, be careful with this snack! Last time I got poked handling it!
Most ogre prey is quite dim, but careless hunters may find the roles reversed!
The butcher tosses chilled meat into a boiling cauldron. The resulting broth grants the surrounding ogres extraordinary regenerative powers.
If we run out of proper ammunition, just break off bits of scrap and fire them!
A great flood once swept the world, devouring all. Heroes arise so that no more heroes are needed.
What awaits the smug destroyers of the Old Ones' great works?
Chotec's temple radiates the warmth of the Sun God, inspiring vigor and vitality among his warriors.
The mummified First Slaan sits serenely as wild winds of magic rage around him, chanting cryptic words: annihilation.
The arcane secrets of the Winds of Magic, etched by Tepok himself in the patterns of the microcosmic heavens, enlighten all magic masters.
The Tzunki crystal, steeped for millennia in the Emerald Pool, can reclaim brave warriors' souls from the Chaos Wastes.
Under the direction of the Great Stargazer, celestial bodies themselves are summoned to crush the enemy tide.
Even the greatest works can gather dust. Rally yourself!
While there is still breath, do not relent.
The spirit ascends from the spirit platform, crossing the river of the afterlife under the banners of ten thousand troops.
Tiny streams of effort merge into a vast tide, culminating in an unparalleled storm of magic.
The summoned spirits gracefully vanish from the warriors' sight, as if fading into the mists.
The best way to counter spellcasters is to sever their connection to the Winds of Magic.
In Cathay, there is a beast, resembling a water buffalo, black as lacquer, that chews iron and swallows copper.
All things must balance, like dark and light, moon and sun, male and female.
The winds of Heaven abandon these forms, returning to the grasp of the Dragon Emperor—it's too late...
The construct suffers catastrophic damage, with severed limbs and wreckage scattered everywhere. Its connection to the winds of Heaven is on the brink—there must still be a way...
The construct has sustained damage, destabilizing its link to the winds of Heaven. Act swiftly to restore balance!
Divine spirits manifest their will; judge and act accordingly.
Even Chaos laments Heaven's perceived indifference.
Heaven creates all things to nurture life.
The heavens roar with thunderous anger, sparing none in their righteous fury.
The soul of the Bloodfire Dragon is bound to the eternal will of the Blood God, capable of unleashing searing flames from the depths of the Brass Citadel.
On the battlefield, there's never a shortage of skulls and souls. Need one? Just chop it off an enemy's neck. What? A spirit, you say?
When this beast wreaks havoc, everyone can clearly hear its blood-curdling roar echoing across the battlefield.
A river of blood, a field of corpses—a grotesque paradise for a weapon forged in Khorne's name.
Run, cowards! Your flesh and blood are the perfect fuel for the rampaging iron bull!
Rise, Eighth Legion! Let your failures ignite the fury of the Blood Realm! Freedom is near, but only with the Bloodfather's blessing!
Molten bronze perpetually flows to seal wounds, a blessing reserved for the most devout servants of Khorne. As for that mad bull? A flawed creation.
The Liche King conjures dark magic amidst a desert storm, leaving torn limbs and dying foes in its wake.
Wings woven from tormented souls spread wide, scattering the Grim Reaper's gift from above!
Listen closely to the whispers from the underworld; the god of the afterlife craves the souls of the living.
Blessed by the Gods: Settra's Divine Avatar
Petra's most exalted blessing is the golden body and supreme power of the undying emperor.
Divine Titan Form: Settra's Divine Avatar
Petra's most exalted blessing is the golden body and supreme power of the undying emperor.
Servant of Nagash: Arkhan's Necromantic Avatar
Arkhan drains the vast dark magic of the Black Tower, unleashing the power Nagash left within him.
Divine Titan Form: Arkhan's Divine Avatar
Arkhan drains the vast dark magic of the Black Tower, unleashing the power Nagash left within him.
Divine Titan Form: Khalida's Divine Avatar
Asaph's blessing fuels the warrior queen's thirst for vengeance, turning her bowstring into a cold, venomous bite.
Divine Titan Form: Khatep's Divine Avatar
Though exiled, the contributions of the Mortuary Cult to Nehekhara earned the great priest Tahoth's favor.
The wrath of the Goddess of Vengeance guides the arrows of the Supreme Queen's legion, their venomous tips capable of saturating the earth.
Through exile's solitude and torment, the Grand Priest came to understand the dark side of even the gods' curses.
Holy Titans guide the souls of fallen kings, dispersing the evil spirits lurking in darkness and banishing the demons that prey on wandering souls.
Realm of Souls: Bone Ostrich Riders
Brave warriors revived from the Realm of Souls ride massive skeletal ostriches, striking with deadly speed and precision.
Intruders daring to disturb the rest of the Tomb Kings shall face the wrath of ancient tyrants' souls.
The Tomb Prince, buried in sand, wields his chess piece and transforms into a lion.
(Ancient Nehekhara) Soldiers, awaken! All intruders must die!
Soulbound obsidian ignites into a blaze of fury.
(Ancient Nehekhara) Disturb my rest and refuse to kneel, and you shall perish here!
The holy avatar of the Emperor of Nehekhara stands tall, paralyzing all who dare gaze upon its majestic form.
The Lord of Golden Bones points to the sky, summoning searing beams of sunlight to incinerate foes into ashes.
In the name of the Vulture God, summon an endless storm at sea and a flock of black vultures to drench and terrify your enemies.
In the name of the Vulture God, summon an endless storm at sea and a flock of black vultures to drench and terrify your enemies.
Its fiery body embodies the pride and fury of a vast and troubled homeland.
In the world's infancy, surrounded by darkness and ice, He, like a generous king, pierced the sky with fire, illuminating all creation.
Death, like marrow-piercing frost; barred doors cannot resist. Though summer returns to bloom, we cannot escape winter's doom.
Death, like marrow-piercing frost; barred doors cannot resist. Though summer returns to bloom, we cannot escape winter's doom.
Death, like marrow-piercing frost; barred doors cannot resist. Though summer returns to bloom, we cannot escape winter's doom.
Death, like marrow-piercing frost; barred doors cannot resist. Though summer returns to bloom, you too cannot escape winter's doom!
Death, like marrow-piercing frost; barred doors cannot resist. Though summer returns to bloom, you too cannot escape winter's doom!
Its tranquil body embodies the pride and fury of a vast and troubled homeland.
The noble swan ascends to heaven, leaving its fears and woes behind...
Salyak is vital to this land. Prayers often come from the warriors' mothers, but She does not save those whose time has come.
Its tempestuous body embodies the pride and fury of a vast and troubled homeland.
As storms gather, Tor's fury is unleashed through thunder, lightning, and rain, striking with divine retribution.
Lightning shatters the sky; Tor's thunder rends the soul!
Its icy body embodies the pride and fury of a vast and troubled homeland.
The Father's chilling roar rallies Kislev's warriors beneath his banner. Their fate is intertwined, and the nation's destiny lies with its standard.
The violent flow of dark magic causes an explosion, injuring everyone nearby. However, the caster themselves will find it difficult to channel the Winds of Magic afterward.
Black Ark pirates are natural foes of sea beasts. They use spikes, giant nets, grappling hooks, and barbed chains to capture, bind, or take down fleeing beasts, eventually dismembering them.
Witches summon a blood pool filled with tainted blood using dark magic, lowering it from the deck of the Black Ark. The impact is highly destructive, as the blood is both filthy and corrosive.
The souls of countless slaves aboard the Black Ark are "extracted" and launched into the sky through spells, crashing down like a deadly deluge.
The hydra's heads channel all their magic to incinerate everything hated by the sorceress goddess.
You might feel exhilarated for severing one of its heads! But should you dare gaze upon this twisted creation, you'll soon succumb to nightmares of madness and illusion.
The cursed hydra's mutilated body releases immense dark energy as it regenerates, only to devour everything once restored.
The statue of Khaine yearns to be bathed in blood, tormenting the souls trapped within. It never tolerates cowardice or weakness.
In these dark and challenging times, Khaine's wrathful rage serves as our guiding light.
The dark soul of Malus Darkblade momentarily separates from the treacherous demon Tz'arkan, but it won't last for long.
If these maddened witches fight alongside you, no matter how infused your weapon is with arcane energy, it will all be silenced amidst the wails of agony.
A slight touch might leave you numb and weak, but if misfortune strikes, the victim will watch their heart being pierced!
One of the many adaptations of deep-sea drakes is using the agony of the abyss as a weapon against prey.
The Knights of the Black Tower share their minions' ferocious combat instincts. Their cracking whips easily rile beasts into a battle frenzy.
The surging waves can easily extinguish nearby flames, obscure your figure, and hinder enemy movement.
The turbulent waters surrounding the flagship not only extinguish nearby flames but also hinder enemy movement, while its towering lookout ensures no foe escapes unseen.
The lost spirits of Yvresse can return to the mortal world through the guidance of the Waystone, clad in enchanted golden armor, illuminating the eternal mists with their resolve and power.
The Age of Dragons may be over, but the pride of the Caledorians never wanes. The flames that once raged upon the peaks now blaze within every Caledor elf.
Flying fish employ a near-miraculous hunting technique, adjusting the jet of stored icy water based on the target's size and distance, suffocating prey from the deep sea.
Once the Skycutters secure air dominance, they use bolt throwers to scatter enemy forces, quickly delivering ammunition to allies in greatest need.
The power of Kurnous flows through their veins as they charge forth in service of the Wild King.
Sacrificing oneself to Morai-Heg is a dark and grueling ritual, but in the face of apocalypse, there are always those who will take on the burden.
These eerie blue magical bows absorb malice collected by the user, returning it as more fearsome arrows, though they cannot harm allies.
You've seen that high wall in your dreams, haven't you? It's a green hell filled with poison and thorns. You'll never want to approach it.
Transcendent and stoic, they strike down enemies in the name of the Forest and the Beast Lord.
With the agility of a perfect dancer, their unpredictable movements suddenly turn lethal as warped branches pierce hearts from behind.
The unyielding spirit of the white birch awaits the rebirth of slumbering life from the ashes, heralding the Wild Hunt's clarion call.
Nature answers Orion's call, raining a torrent of arrows upon invaders of Athel Loren.
As the natural world continues to decline, Ariel grows increasingly combative, sustaining her perilous moth-like form.
Ancient oak branches fall to the ground, rebirthing dryads in flames. Their souls brim with unwavering devotion to Athel Loren, leaving enemies no choice but death.
Spring has arrived in Athel Loren, reviving ancient spirits to nurture the living. The Asrai lines stand firm as roots of mighty oaks.
Resilient aspen spirits break their charred branches, twisting them with lightning to craft new arrows. Their pain finds solace only in the remains of their foes.
This spell summons gnarled, twisted roots from the ground, entrapping and suffocating enemies.
Sharp metal spikes twisted into shapes to ensure the point is always facing up.
A simple explosive device disguised as a Dwarf shield.
The Thunderbarge's bombs are significantly larger than those of the Bombers. Multiple bombs hitting the target can result in explosive devastation!
Power of the Five Elements Compass
Hooks and clasps: the ends are hooks, the middle clasps; used appropriately, they either pull or push with precision.
Harness the spiritual energy of heaven and earth to restore the essence of yang.
Facing thousands in battle, they grow stronger, carving a path as if no one could stand before them—a paragon of invincible courage.
Dragon's Insight illuminates all, penetrating and understanding everything.
Dragon's Valor stands fearless and firm, unyielding in the face of adversity.
Dragon's Ferocity burns like a blazing flame, exuding an indomitable aura.
Dragon's Resolve is like an unshakable mountain, eternal and steadfast.
The deafening roar of fire lances fills the air, laying waste to everything.
Three mighty axe blows of tremendous power, yet exhausting their use leaves the wielder defenseless.
Harness the power of the Five Elements Compass for the mage's use.
When the wind strikes the Tuo Drums, the mountains and rivers shake; lightning flashes above the banners, reaching sun and moon.
Though unable to take the form of a true dragon, one can still awaken its might.
Though unable to take the form of a true dragon, one can still awaken its might.
Golden helm, golden armor, cinnabar robe; purple eyes, crimson brows, and verdant mane.
The souls of our Celestial warriors shall be claimed by Heaven itself—how could we allow the foul Daemons of Tzeentch to defile them?
The storm took my dearest friend. The lightning pulled me back from death. From pain I rose again—becoming the thunder that tears through the dark!
Arcs of lightning leap from the scar upon Hafdan's chest, bursting forth with dazzling brilliance as he smashes enemy skulls—healing Thor's Chosen and driving him ever forward.
Blood-drenched Son of Thor raises his warhammer high—lightning howls from the heavens, cleansing the foul beasts that dare violate the motherland’s borders.
In the hands of Old-Kan, this great hammer moves like an extension of his limbs—each casual blow fuses warm-bloods and their so-called fine armor into a single mass of gore.
Sharp and heavy, blessed with the wild fury of the Beast God Itzi. Forged and honed by a legion of Skink craftsmen, this mighty axe can decapitate even the thick-necked Carnosaur in one fell swoop.
Assembled from the proudest trophies felled by Old-K’ja, this thick armor endures the searing heat of a Solar Engine—arrows and bullets feel like mere scratches on its hide.
Within the twisted flesh brews devastating dimensional lightning, potent enough to pierce the toughest armor.
When the warpstone runs dry, the fire dies down... but these hairless wretches will feel the *real* explosion, yes-yes!
